title: Sony Xperia X gets massive cut of Rs 14000 in India but should you buy? : News, News - India Today
text:
Last Updated: FEB 20, 2017 New Delhi Email Author 
Sony has slashed the price of company's 2016 flagship Xperia X in India. The smartphone has received a massive price-cut of Rs 14000, lowering its price to Rs 24,990. This is the second timer Sony has lowered the price of Xperia X for its Indian buyers. Earlier in September 2016, the company had slashed the price by Rs 10,000, bringing the selling price to Rs 38,990. The smartphone is available on Flipkart in various colours. Also Read: Sony Xperia X gets massive Rs 10,000 price cut in India 
If you are a Sony user and looking to buy a mid-range phone with good camera specs then Xperia X is a good buy for you now. Many, including our own review called it an over-priced phone with an awesome camera specs. The phone clicks amazing photos with rich and vibrant colours during daylight. It also captures good quality shots with shallow depth of field and performs pretty well even in tricky light situations. 
Just to recall, Sony launched the Xperia X in June last year. The launch price of the phone was Rs 48,990 which was reduced to Rs 38,990 in September. The Xperia X comes with a 5-inch FullHD display and runs Qualcomm Snapdragon 650 processor coupled with 3GB of RAM and 32GB of internal memory. The smartphone sports a 23-megapixel camera that has a large 1/2.3" Exmor RS image sensor, predictive hybrid auto focus, quick launch (less than 0.03 seconds), 5x clear image zoom, 24mm wide-angle G Lens F2.0 aperture and Pulse LED flash. On the front is a 13-megapixel selfie-shooter with 22mm wide-angle lens and Exmor RS image sensor.
